## Public Constructors

### LoopVectorizeOptions() {#a6783f8be2f000616bf0c2c34cae65ad0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="llvm::LoopVectorizeOptions::LoopVectorizeOptions ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The current defaults when creating the pass with no arguments are: EnableLoopInterleaving = true and EnableLoopVectorization = true.

This means that interleaving default is consistent with the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt</a> flag, while vectorization is not. FIXME: The default for EnableLoopVectorization in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt</a> should be set to true, and the corresponding change to account for this be made in opt.cpp. The initializations below will become: InterleaveOnlyWhenForced(!EnableLoopInterleaving) VectorizeOnlyWhenForced(!EnableLoopVectorization).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h/#l00102">102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h">LoopVectorize.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### InterleaveOnlyWhenForced {#ac6ffc347deee18f567b88ce71101d45d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::LoopVectorizeOptions::InterleaveOnlyWhenForced">
If false, consider all loops for interleaving.

If true, only loops that explicitly request interleaving are considered.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h">LoopVectorize.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### VectorizeOnlyWhenForced {#ac73f29a1b055929ead9221ab91e1dd10}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::LoopVectorizeOptions::VectorizeOnlyWhenForced">
If false, consider all loops for vectorization.

If true, only loops that explicitly request vectorization are considered.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loopvectorize-h">LoopVectorize.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
